str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful. A primary verb; to bind.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A linen bandage, a wrapping. Neuter of a presumed derivative of othone; a linen bandage.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Spice, perfume. From airo; an aromatic.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
To embalm, prepare for burial. From a compound of en and taphos; to inswathe with cerements for interment.
A custom, habit; an institute, rite. From etho; a usage.
